examples: I erased that note because it was wrong.

definitions.definition: To obliterate information from (a storage medium ), such as to clear or (with magnetic storage) to demagnetize .
examples: I'm going to erase this tape.

definitions.definition: To obliterate ( information ) from a storage medium , such as to clear or to overwrite .
examples: I'm going to erase those files.

definitions.definition: To remove a runner from the bases via a double play or pick off play
examples: Jones was erased by a 6-4-3 double play.

definitions.definition: To be erased ( have markings removed, have information removed , or be cleared of information ) .
To disregard (a group, an orientation, etc.); to prevent from having an active role in society .

main_definition: ( transitive ) to remove markings or information
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To obliterate information from (a storage medium ), such as to clear or (with magnetic storage) to demagnetize .
( transitive ) To obliterate ( information ) from a storage medium , such as to clear or to overwrite .
( transitive , baseball ) To remove a runner from the bases via a double play or pick off play
( intransitive ) To be erased ( have markings removed, have information removed , or be cleared of information ) .
( transitive ) To disregard (a group, an orientation, etc.); to prevent from having an active role in society .
